subject: Business
title: The Infinite Scroll: Designing for Addiction
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Infinite Scroll: Designing for Addiction.

hook.text: You open Instagram for one minute. Forty-five minutes later, you're still scrolling. It's designed that way.

buildup.text: Infinite scroll removes natural stopping points. Without a page break, there's no cue to stop.

discovery.text: Variable rewards â€” sometimes interesting, sometimes not â€” create the same dopamine pattern as slot machines.

twist.text: Tristan Harris, ex-Google, calls this 'the attention extraction economy.' Your time is the product being sold.

climax.text: Some platforms now add 'time spent' reminders. Critics say it's like a casino putting clocks on the wall â€” too little.

punchline.text: If there's no end, you were never meant to stop.

quiz.question: Why does infinite scroll keep users engaged so long?
